variant.question:

METAR EGLC **231720** 260/10kt **3000** HZ NSW

options.text: Less than 3 000 m but more than 1 500 m.
Less than 3 000 m and less than 2 000 m.
Less than 5 000 m but more than 1 500 m.

variant.question: Compare meteorological visibility(Note RA = rain, DZ = drizzle, FG = fog, SN = snow, BR = mist)

visibility is greater in FG than in DZ.
visibility is lower in BR than in +SN.
visibility is lower in RA than in DZ.

variant.question: A meteorological observer is making observations for a METAR. The observer judges the visibility to be 1200 m, with the restriction caused by water droplets suspended in the air. Its restriction to visibility is:
Which of following is true regarding the height of a convective cloud base?

options.text: The cloud base will increase with increasing surface temperatures.
The cloud base will be lower as pressure increases.
The cloud base will rise with increasing surface wind.
The cloud base will rise with reduced density.

variant.question: The 3 elements in a cloud report in a METAR or TAF report are

METAR LEXX 211730Z 26008KT 220V320 3000 HZ SKC Q1010. 
At what distance would a pilot expect to see the threshold of runway 26 from the direction of approach?

options.text: More than 1500 m but less than 3000 m.
More than 1000 m but less than 1500 m.

options.text: moderate or poor because there is no vertical exchange
very good in the early morning

Between 1 and 2 oktas of cloud present.

variant.question: The heights of cloud bases in TAFs are reported as being

Surface visibility at your destination in the centre of France in August is reported as 1500 metres in haze, with an inversion at 500 feet above aerodrome level and sky clear above. When making a non-precision approach to runway 18 shortly before sunset with a minimum descent altitude of 600 feet above aerodrome level, at what range would you expect to see the runway and why?

options.text: More than 1500 metres because the aircraft will still be flying above the haze.
Less than 1500 metres because the Sun in the pilot's eyes will reduce the ability to distinguish objects and therefore air-to-ground visibility.
Less than 1500 metres because the sunlight reflecting from the mist particles will reduce flight visibility.
Less than 1500 metres because the sunlight reflecting from the top of the mist layer will reduce air-to-ground visibility.

variant.question:
What is the lowest possible cloud base forecast for 23:00 UTC?

EDDF 272200Z 2806/2824 VRB05KT 4000 BR SCT005 OVC013 BECMG 2813/2814 9000 SHRA OVC015 PROB40 TEMPO 2814/2816 VRB15G25KT 1600 TSRA OVC010CB BECMG 2816/2818 26010KT BECMG 2821/2822 CAVOK=

In the weather briefing room during the pre-flight phase of a passenger flight from Zurich to Rome, you examine the following weather reports of pressing importance at the time:
EINN SHANNON **2808** SIGMET 2 VALID **0800**/**1100** LOC SEV TURB FCST EINN FIR BLW FL050 SOUTH OF 53N WKN =
LIMM MILAN **2809** SIGMET 2 VALID **0900**/**1500** MOD SEV CAT BTN FL250 AND FL430 FCST LIMM FIR STNR NC =
EGLL LONDON **2808** SIGMET NR01 VALID **0800**/**1200** FOR LONDON FIR ISOL CB EMBD IN LYR CLOUD FCST TOPS FL300 BTN 52N AND 54N EAST OF 002E SEV ICE SEV TURB TS ALSO FCST MOV E WKN =
Which decision is correct?

options.text: Because of the expected turbulence you select a flight level below FL250.
You show no further interest in these reports, since they do not concern the route to be flown.
You cancel the flight since the expected dangerous weather conditions along the route would demand too much of the passengers.
Owing to these reports and taking into account the presence of heavy thunderstorms at planned FL310 you select a higher flight level (FL370).

variant.question: A SIGMET:

options.text: is a warning of meteorological hazards in the FIR for all aircraft.
is added as a short-term forecast to the actual weather report of an airport.
reports the actual weather of an airport every 30 minutes.
is a route forecast, issued several times during the day by the Met Offices.

variant.question:
Select the correct answer regarding the following METAR:
LSGG **1520z** **21001KT** **2000** SN **OVC010** 02/02 **Q1020** BLSN
A METAR is reporting a visibility of 8 km. Added to the report is a "BECMG **4000**". From this you will expect the visibility to:

options.text: Decrease to 4 km within the next 2 hours.
Improve from 4 km to 8 km in the next 2 hours.

variant.question: METAR EGTK **090950Z** **09003KT** **6000** NSC 04/00 **Q1031** NOSIG Considering the above METAR, fill in the missing words: There are no ___(1)___ under the height of ___(2)___ above the aerodrome, and no ___(3)___ at any height. No expected changes within the next ___(4)___.

options.text: (1) Clouds covering more than half of the sky; (2) 5 000ft; (3) CB; (4) 2 hours.

variant.question: What is the relationship between meteorological visibility and RVR in homogeneous fog?

options.text: The visibility is generally less than the RVR.
There is no specific relationship between the two.
The visibility is generally the same as the RVR.
The visibility is generally greater than the RVR.

variant.question:
In the weather briefing room, during the pre-light phase of a commercial flight from Zurich to Rome, the pilot examines the following weather reports of pressing importance at the time: EINN SHANNON 2808 SIGMET 2 VALID 0800/1100 LOC SEV TURB FCST EINN FIR BLW FL050 SOUTH OF 53N WKN = 
  
 LIMM MILAN 2809 SIGMET 2 VALID 0900/1500 MOD SEV CAT BTN FL250 AND FL430 FCST LIMM FIR STNR NC = 
  
 EGLL LONDON 2808 SIGMET NR01 VALID 0800/1200 FOR LONDON FIR ISOL CB EMBD IN LYR CLOUD FCST TOPS FL300 BTN 52N AND 54N EAST OF 002E SEV ICE SEV TURB TS ALSO FCST MOV E WKN = What is the most appropriate decision?

options.text: Because of the expected turbulence, the pilot selects a fight level below FL250.
The pilot shows no further interest in these reports, since they do not concern the route to be owned.
Owing to these reports and taking into account the presence of heavy thunderstorms at planned FL310, the pilot selects a higher fight level (FL370).
The pilot cancels the fight since the expected dangerous weather conditions along the route would demand too much of the passengers.

variant.question: A particular METAR states 4000 m of visibility. This can refer to the visibility of a light on an unlit background. The intesity of this light is how many candelas?

Flight from Bordeaux to Amsterdam, ETA 2100 UTC. What is the minimum visibility forecast for ETA Amsterdam?
 TAF EHAM 281500Z 2816/2901 14010KT 6000 -RA SCT025 BECMG 2816/2818 12015G25KT SCT008 BKN013 TEMPO 2818/2823 3000 RA BKN005 OVC010 BECMG 2823/2901 25020KT 8000 NSW=
The cloud base in a METAR of a land station is reported as..

EGBB **251450Z** **30029G39KT** **8000** **2000W** SCT010CB BKN020 09/06 Q1005=
Suddenly, lightning is observed from one of the CB clouds just over the airfield and a loud rumble follows. What is the correct action to be performed by the ATS unit?

options.text: Advise the approaching traffics to divert to an alternate airport, due to the current adverse conditions at destination.

variant.question: The meteorological term "ceiling" is defined as the height of the base of the lowest clouds:

options.text: That cover more than half the sky.
That cover at least half the sky.

variant.question: Runway visual range can be reported in

options.text: both a TAF and a METAR.

variant.question: What is the meaning of 'RERA' in a METAR?

options.text: There has been moderate or heavy rain since the last issue of METAR.
There is showery precipitation in the vicinity.
It is presently not raining, but there has been rain 2 hours ago.
The intensity of rain is decreasing (Retrograding Rain).

Which of the following meteorological phenomena can rapidly change the braking action of a runway?

What is the height of the lowest cloud forecast for Bangkok at ETA 14:00 UTC?

TAF VTBD 271800Z 2800/2824 VRB05KT 1200 BR TEMPO 2800/2802 4000 BECMG 2802/2805 9999 NSW SCT015 BKN100 TEMPO 2811/2818 04010G20KT 4500 TSRA SCT009 BKN014 BKN018CB BECMG 2820/2824 4000=

What minimum visibility is forecast for PARIS/CHARLES-DE-GAULLE at 2100 UTC?

Decode the SIGMET below:EGJJ SIGMET 03 VALID 291130/291530 EGJJ-LOC SEV TURB AND WS FCST BLW 3000FT OVER THE CHANNEL ISLANDS AREA INTSF=Which of the following statements best describes the SIGMET content?

options.text: Over the Channel islands area severe turbulence and wind shear are forecasted which will increase during the forecast period.
Over the Channel islands area severe turbulence and wind speeds below 3 000 ft are forecasted which will decrease during the forecast period.
Over the Channel islands area severe turbulence and wind speeds below 3 000 ft are forecasted which will increase during the forecast period.
Over the Channel islands area severe turbulence and wind shear are forecasted which will decrease during the forecast period.

variant.question:
What does the phrase EMBD TS OBS AND FCST mean in the following SIGMET and what is the vertical extent of the accompanying cloud?
EKDK COPENHAGEN FIR EMBD TS OBS AND FCST 20NM ON EITHER SIDE OF LINE 5500N 5725N TOP OF CB FL370 STNR NC=

options.text:
Embedded thunderstorms observed and forecast
Tops of the CB extends up to Flight Level 370

Embedded thunder/sleet observed and forcast
Tops of the CB extends up to Flight Level 370

Emboldend thunderstorms observed
Tops of the CB extends up to Flight Level 370

Embedded thundershowers obvious inthe forecast
Tops up to FL370

variant.question: A SIGMET announces Severe Mountain Waves in the region of your aircraft, stating FL70/200 WKN. What does this mean?

options.text: There are mountain waves at FL70 with at least 600 ft/min downdrafts.
There are mountain waves at FL70 with at least 200 kt wind from the East.
There are mountain waves at FL70 with at least 200 kt wind from the West.
There are mountain waves at FL70 with at least 200 ft/min downdrafts.

variant.question:
(Refer to image)
To which aerodrome is the following TAF most applicable ?
 
TAF 231019 24014KT 6000 SCT030 BKN100 TEMPO 1113 25020G38KT 2500 +TSRA SCT008 BKN025CB BECMG 1315 28012KT 9999 SCT025 TEMPO 5000 SHRA BKN020 BECMG 1719 27008KT 9999 SCT030
Runway Visual Range is...

options.text: measured with ceilometers alongside the runway
reported when visibility is less than 2000m

variant.question: What is the meaning of the symbol attached?

A pilot wants to select airport for arrival with a runway where RVR is at least 550 metres. Considering the following METARs, valid for the arrival time, and choose the appropriate airport (assume all other criteria for landing to each airport).
EGKK 191050Z 09002KT 0200 FZFG R08R/0350 R08L/0500 VV001 M03/M02 Q100B WS RWY08R.EGLF 191050Z 07003KT 0200 FZFG R06/0700D VV001 M03/M03 Q1008.EGGW 191050Z 08004KT 0200 FZFG R08/0300U VV001 M02/M02 Q1007.EGLL 191050Z 09002KT 0100 FZFG R09L/0300U R09R/0500U VV001 M02/M02 Q1008.
In the METAR code the abbreviation VC indicates:

options.text: Present weather within a range of between approximately 8 and 16 km of the aerodrome reference point but not at the airport.
Present weather within the approach area.

variant.question: Up to what altitude and in what increments is the vertical visibility reported in a METAR?
The units of measurement used for RVR are:

options.text: Meters (m) or feet (ft), at states discretion.

variant.question: How is the meteorological visibility determined in the METAR?

options.text: It is the greatest value which is reached at least within half of the horizon as seen from the aerodrome.
The maximum determined by a meteorologist in a 360° scan at the horizon.
Given by transmissometer when the visibility is below 1 500 metres.
The lowest observed in a 360° scan from the meteorological station.

variant.question: How is the meteorological visibility determined in the METAR?

options.text: It is the greatest value which is reached at least within half of the horizon as seen from the aerodrome.
It is the greatest value which is reached at least within three quarters of the horizon as seen from the aerodrome.
It is the maximum determined by a meteorologist in a 360° scan at the horizon.
It is given by transmissometers when the visibility is below 1 500 meters.

variant.question: According to ICAO, vertical visibility should be reported: - When expressed in meters, in steps of 30 m up to 600 m. - When expressed in feet, in steps of 100 ft up to 2 000 ft.

What does the following abbreviations means?
OBSC TS
SEV MTW
SEV TURB

options.text:
OBSC TS means obscured (by smoke, have or darkness) thunderstorms or cumulonimbus
SEV MTW means marked mountain wave
SEV TURB means severe turbulence - other than that in CBs or a tropical cyclone

OBSC TS means observed stratocumulonimbus and thundershowers
SEV MTW means severe mountain waves
SEV TURB means several encounters of turbulence reported

OBSC TS  means obscured (by smoke, have or darkness) thunderstorms or cumulonimbus
SEV MTW means several mountain waves reported
SEV TURB means severe turbulence - other than that in CBs or a tropical cyclone

OBSC TS means obscured (by smoke, have or darkness) thunderstorms or cumulonimbus
SEV MTW means severe mountain waves reported
SEV TURB means several reports of turbulence - other than that in CBs or a tropical cyclone

variant.question:
(See image)
Which of the following is the best description of the meteorological situation at location J on the chart?
Which best describes the weather, if any, at Lyon / Satolas at 1330 UTC given the following TAF / METAR?

VTSP CNL AD WRNG 2 300100/300300 
 This message means:

options.text: The aerodrome warning number 2 issued at VTSP is canceled.
There is an aerodrome warning between 01:00Z and 03:00Z on the 30th of the month.
The aerodrome VTSP is closed during the mentioned timeframe.
There are two occasional warnings for a certain weather phenomena.

variant.question: When will the surface wind in a METAR record a gust factor?

options.text: When gusts are at least 10 knots above the mean wind speed.
When gusts are at least 15 knots above the mean wind speed.
With gusts of at least 35 knots.
With gusts of at least 25 knots.

What are the units of measurement used for RVR?

options.text: Meters (m) or feet (ft) at discretion of State.

variant.question: RVR is reported when meteorological visibility falls below

Given the following 

METAREDDM 250850Z 33005KT 2000 R26R/P1500N R26L/1500N BR SCT002 OVC003 05/05 Q1025 NOSIG= 

Which of the following statements is correct ?

options.text: Visibility is reduced by water droplets
There is a distinct change in RVR observed
Runway 26R and runway 26L have the same RVR

variant.question: What is the definition of gusts?

options.text: Maximum wind speeds (gusts) and minimums (lulls) about the average wind velocity.
The average variation of the minimum wind speed.
The variation of the average peak wind speed
The variation of the average wind speed.

variant.question: What is the definition of gusts?

options.text: Maximum of windspeed (gust) and minimum (lull) about the average wind velocity.
The variation of the average peak wind speed.
The average variation of the minimum wind speed.
The variation of the average windspeed.
